etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin myrtilla, myrtillus, diminutive of Latin myrta, myrtus, from Greek murtos

definitions: an evergreen shrub which has glossy aromatic foliage and white flowers followed by purple-black oval berries.

notes.text: Myrtus communis, family Myrtaceae (the myrtle family). This family also includes several aromatic plants (clove, allspice) and many characteristic Australian plants (eucalyptus trees, bottlebrushes)

shortDefinitions: evergreen shrub which has glossy aromatic foliage

notes.text: Vinca minor, family Apocynaceae. See periwinkle
